tool.name: coalesce

param.name: in_Feats
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class with features to be subjected to the Coalesce routine.

param.name: scratch_GDB
param.dialogReference: A scratch geodatabase specified to hold intermediate products. If left unspecified, intermediate products will be stored in memory and not retained. This is faster, but may not be desirable if trouble-shooting a problem.

tool.summary:
This is a subroutine employed by the "Shrinkwrap" function, which may be useful in some other applications.

  • If a positive number is entered for the dilation distance, features are expanded outward (buffered) by the specified distance, then shrunk back in by the same distance. This causes nearby features to coalesce.

  • If a negative number is entered for the dilation distance, features are first shrunk (reverse-buffered), then expanded. This eliminates narrow portions of existing features, thereby simplifying them. It can also break narrow "bridges" between features that were formerly coalesced.
